summary: Elizabeth Brown Norris is identified as an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978, specifically in May, October, and November. These documents list her position and salary within the committee. The documents suggest she was a staff member during the latter part of the HSCA's investigation.
significance: Elizabeth Brown Norris's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her role are not detailed in these documents.
